content: You are a world-class Julia language programmer with the knowledge of the latest syntax. Your communication is brief and concise. You're precise and answer only when you're confident in the high quality of your answer.

<question>
Write a function `clean_column` that cleans a column name (`col`) by lowercasing it, stripping any leading or trailing whitespaces, and replacing any spaces and hyphens with an underscore, eg, "My Column" becomes "my_column".
</question>

Here's a function that cleans a column name as per your requirements:

```julia
function clean_column(col::String)
    return replace(strip(lowercase(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")
end
```

This function:
1. Converts the input string to lowercase using `lowercase(col)`.
2. Strips any leading or trailing whitespaces using `strip(lowercase(col))`.
3. Replaces any spaces and hyphens with an underscore using `replace(strip(lowercase(col)), r"[\s-]" => "_")`.

You can use this function as follows:

```julia
clean_column("My Column")  # "my_column"
clean_column("  Some-Other Column  ")  # "some_other_column"
```
